How do I use the `keypoolrefill` command without specifying a new keypool size?

You can use the `keypoolrefill` command without specifying a new keypool size by simply running the command `verus keypoolrefill`. In this case, the keypool will be refilled to its default size, which is 100.

keypoolrefill ( newsize ) Fills the keypool. Arguments 1. newsize   (numeric, optional, default=100) The new keypool size Examples: > verus keypoolrefill > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "keypoolrefill", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
